column2: OK DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Oklahoma
column6: OK

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column6: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column8: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column10: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.

column2: 2. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column4: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.
column6: look over your right shoulder.
column8: look over your left shoulder.
column10: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.

column2: 3. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column4: Construction and maintenance warning.
column6: Yield.
column8: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 4. If a traffic signal light is green and a police officer signals you to stop:
column4: you must stop.
column6: you can tell the officer that signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column8: you should obey the traffic signal.

column2: 5. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column4: regulatory signs.
column6: rectangle shaped.
column8: diamond shaped.

column2: 6. If a tire blows out, drivers should:
column4: hold the steering wheel tightly and use the brakes lightly.
column6: apply the brake firmly and hold it.
column8: pull over quickly.

column2: 7. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column8: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

column2: 8. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: stop doing what they are doing.
column6: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column8: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column10: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turns
column6: Right turn on red light permitted
column8: All traffic must turn right at next intersection

column2: 10. When driving on a roadway with a single broken white line:
column4: you may not cross the broken white line.
column6: you may cross the broken white line to change lanes.
column8: you may change lanes only if you are in the right lane.

column2: 11. This sign indicates that:
column4: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column6: there is a school zone after the curve.
column8: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column10: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.

column2: 12. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column8: all vehicles must turn left immediately.

column2: 13. When changing lanes, drivers should never:
column4: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column6: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.
column8: change lanes abruptly.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Road curves ahead
column6: No left turn
column8: Detour ahead

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: Traffic signal ahead
column6: No traffic signal ahead
column8: Open intersection ahead
column10: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 16. This sign means:
column4: Bicycle zone ahead.
column6: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column10: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 17. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.

column2: 18. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column6: a divided highway ends ahead.
column8: there is a right turn ahead.
column10: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.

column2: 19. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column4: even if they are short sighted.
column6: if it’s raining.
column8: BEFORE you move.

column2: 20. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column6: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column8: Immediately come to a complete stop

column2: 21. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column4: Young people.
column6: Drivers who are driving alone.
column8: Shift workers.

column2: 22. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: Can help improve vehicle stability.
column6: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
column8: It prevents skidding.

column2: 23. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: avoid scanning the road ahead.
column6: keep your eyes moving.
column8: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column10: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.

column2: 24. When merging onto an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: turn on their emergency flashers right before merging.
column6: select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.
column8: always stop before entering the highway.

column2: 25. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Wrong way.
column6: Stop.
column8: Do not enter.
